Articles.Content: This is NOT a when will it be released thread! It's more a where thread. I'm not sure where to find the actual like date/info. Like will a thread be made on the dev section on the forum, or will there be a blog post, or dev tweet? The only reason I knew any update was released was seeing posts on the forum about questions relating to them. How long they were live before that point is anyone's guess. Finally where can I find like up to the date info on KSP? Would a dev tweet be the best option?
This contains most of the info: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72587-Kerbal-Space-Program-Asteroid-Redirect-Mission-The-FAQ
Got the feeling that there soon will be the moment for a waiting room-thread, where people start to stare at each other until something is released....
Steam will tell me when i see KSP doing an update download. the next two updates are going to be close but i dont recommend checking often at all until the first one drops.

In this KSP-TV Squadcast, at the end, they announced a stream for I believe this coming weekend where they plan to showcase the ARM pack. I forget the exact date but you can easily get it out of the video.

Also, closed beta testing is ongoing; several copies are floating around in the hands of trustworthy people. Scott Manley admitted to having one, for example, but he of course acknowledges that he can't say a word about what's actually in it.

Based on this, I speculate that we will see a release either this weekend or early next week, when the devs have returned from GDC and found time to wrap up last minute stuff. I'm getting the feeling that they really want to release it already, probably just as much as we want to have it already
When it's released this will be announced everywhere: Facebook, Twitter, Web page, Tumblr, Forums, Steam..... you won't miss it
(stares at Kialar) Yeah, I think its time to start. Squad was at GDC this week, so that probably pushes it back a little. It'll be here when its ready and I am super excited for it!
anyone else think that there will be a totally unexpected awesome feature they havent talked about thats just going to surprise us? maybe not in the ARM but in the .24

In this KSP-TV Squadcast, at the end, they announced a stream for I believe this coming weekend where they plan to showcase the ARM pack. I forget the exact date but you can easily get it out of the video.

anyone remember the time of this upcoming webcast?

When it's released this will be announced everywhere: Facebook, Twitter, Web page, Tumblr, Forums, Steam..... you won't miss it

Yeah, this. Most of the time, I find out about releases when I see people starting a bunch of threads in the forum.

anyone else think that there will be a totally unexpected awesome feature they havent talked about thats just going to surprise us? maybe not in the ARM but in the .24

Regarding the slow pace of updates: nope.
*stares at DoctorCruz with a twitching eyelid*

never been in one of the waiting room threads, but it sounds er... fun ?

I suspect it will be before april and its certain that its soontm

When it's released this will be announced everywhere: Facebook, Twitter, Web page, Tumblr, Forums, Steam..... you won't miss it

Television, newspapers, radio...

The Claw looks a lot like KAS. This has merit for ordinary use (and not just hurling asteroids about). Say, latching onto spent stages, leeching fuel off them, and reeling them in for a drop into a celestial.

Or for improved landings on low-gravity bodies like Gilly, which was ridiculous to get a landing on. Simply grapple, and it can simulate weight.

Maybe if it works like the transfers through docking ports, I can even use it to get fuel and kethane from my miners.

The release seems kinda close now (soonÃ¢â€žÂ¢), so all we can do is wait...

Preferably not on April 1st...
I just hope it has a robotic arm. Yes i know of mods out there but they have parts ive 0 use for

Yeah, this. Most of the time, I find out about releases when I see people starting a bunch of threads in the forum.

Yeah, if I'm at all lucky I find out when I log into KSP for the evening ... but typically releases happen while I'm at work, so I find out either in General Discussion, or in one of the modding threads.
